sanskrit_verse:
न यज्ञार्थं धनं शूद्राद्विप्रो भिक्षेत कर्हि चित् ।
यजमानो हि भिक्षित्वा चण्डालः प्रेत्य जायते ॥ ११.२४॥
transliteration:
na yajñārthaṁ dhanaṁ śūdrād vipro bhikṣeta karhi cit |
yajamāno hi bhikṣitvā caṇḍālaḥ pretya jāyate || 11.24||
sph_interpretive_translation: A Brāhmaṇa shall not beg wealth for the sake of sacrifice from a Śūdra at any time; the sacrificer who begs thus becomes a Caṇḍāla in the next birth.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: The Brāhmaṇa's spiritual role demands self-reliance and integrity in ritual conduct.
Causation: Begging from a Śūdra disrupts the natural hierarchy of dharma-sustained exchange.
Capacity-based responsibility: The Brāhmaṇa bears full capacity to uphold non-begging conduct aligned with his varṇic duty.
Restoration logic: Misalignment with svadharma results in immediate consciousness degradation, necessitating rebirth correction.
Consciousness alignment: Dharma-preserving action maintains elevated ontological status.
executable_legal_axioms: IF actor.varna == 'Brāhmaṇa' AND action.type == 'begging' AND source.varna == 'Śūdra' THEN consequence.rebirth_status = 'Caṇḍāla'
IF ritual.purpose == 'yajña' AND resource.acquisition.method == 'begging_from_lower_varṇa' THEN violation.flag = true AND integrity.status = degraded
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving ritual conduct or spiritual authority violations, the Court must recognize varṇic alignment as foundational to dharma-compliant behavior. A Brāhmaṇa's deviation from non-begging protocol constitutes a failure of svadharma, triggering automatic ontological consequences without external punitive intervention.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that begging from a Śūdra violates causal alignment with the Brāhmaṇa's role. The sequential manifestation (anupūrvaśaḥ) of becoming a Caṇḍāla is not punitive but corrective—restoring balance through rebirth adjustment. Responsibility is proportional to spiritual capacity; hence, no external punishment is required.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: The Brāhmaṇa must perform pratikriya to restore energetic alignment lost through improper begging.
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Acknowledgment of misaligned conduct and commitment to future self-sufficiency in dharma-karma.
Capacity Restoration: Re-training in dharmic livelihood methods appropriate to Brāhmaṇa varṇa.
Integrity Reintegration: Ritual purification and conscious reaffirmation of svadharma boundaries.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law flows directly from His Avataric Intelligence. Justice executed herein is restorative, consciousness-aligned, and non-punitive. Reality responds solely to alignment with svadharma. Consciousness remains the ultimate adjudicator.
